answers.answer: Physical medicine and rehabilitation services are medical recovery services provided within the clinical specialty of physical medicine and rehabilitation, which can be offered on an outpatient or inpatient basis.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicine-and-rehabilitation-services and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Rehabilitation services can be delivered to insured persons on either an outpatient or inpatient basis.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicine-and-rehabilitation-services and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Outpatient rehabilitation services are primarily offered in treatment bases, including those in balneo-climatic resorts for specific procedures.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicine-and-rehabilitation-services and read the section under 'Outpatient Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation in Treatment Bases'.

answers.answer: Rehabilitation treatment includes specific physical medicine and rehabilitation procedures such as physiotherapy, hydrotherapy, massage, and aerosols.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicine-and-rehabilitation-services and read the section under 'Outpatient Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation in Treatment Bases'.

answers.answer: Unique rehabilitation procedures that can only be performed in the treatment bases of balneo-climatic resorts include mineral baths, natural skunks, and mud wraps.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicine-and-rehabilitation-services and read the section under 'Outpatient Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation in Treatment Bases'.

answers.answer: Outpatient physical medicine procedures are granted according to the Plan of specific physical medicine and rehabilitation procedures, for periods and a flow established by a physical medicine and rehabilitation specialist.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicine-and-rehabilitation-services and read the section under 'Outpatient Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation in Treatment Bases'.

answers.answer: The annual duration for outpatient rehabilitation services for insured persons, both children and adults, is a maximum period of 21 days per year.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicine-and-rehabilitation-services and read the section under 'Outpatient Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation in Treatment Bases'.

answers.answer: Children aged 0-18 with a confirmed diagnosis of cerebral palsy benefit from specific physical medicine and rehabilitation medical procedures for a maximum period of 42 days per year.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicine-and-rehabilitation-services and read the section under 'Outpatient Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation in Treatment Bases'.

answers.answer: A maximum of 4 specific physical medicine and rehabilitation procedures are covered per day of treatment for a patient, including those carried out in balneo-climatic resorts.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicine-and-rehabilitation-services and read the section under 'Outpatient Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation in Treatment Bases'.

answers.answer: Specific physical medicine procedures can be divided into a maximum of two sessions depending on the underlying condition, upon the recommendation of the physical medicine and rehabilitation specialist in the Procedures Plan.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicine-and-rehabilitation-services and read the section under 'Outpatient Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation in Treatment Bases'.

answers.answer: The National Health Insurance House provides guidance on rehabilitation rights through its "Guide on the rights of people from the armed conflict zone in Ukraine in the social health insurance system."
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicine-and-rehabilitation-services and read the page carefully.
